titles.title: To make permanent the authority of the Secretary of Commerce to conduct the quarterly financial report program.
To extend by 10 years the authority of the Secretary of Commerce to conduct the quarterly financial report program.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Federalism and the Census.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Government Reform. H. Rept. 109-164.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 101.

action.text: Mr. Turner moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2385.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.
Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.
Senate vitiated previous referral and discharge by Unanimous Consent.
Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.
Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.name: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

bill.summary: 9/30/2005--Public Law. Extends for ten years the authority of the Secretary of Commerce to conduct the quarterly financial reporting program.
